importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The incident occurred on October 19, 2025, and is the central event of the article, highlighting a major traffic-related tragedy in Maryland.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The article was updated at 3:23 PM EDT on October 19, 2025, indicating the latest update on the incident and related developments.

keyTakeAways: A 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, drove into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing one person and injuring 13 others.
The victim who died was Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez, 31, of Washington, DC.
The driver initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in to authorities.
The crash occurred during a birthday party where children were gathered in a tent, and the driver was reported to be driving erratically.
Eyewitness Jocelyn Route, a former school board member and local council member, described hearing explosions and seeing children injured, with emergency personnel attempting resuscitation.
A video on X shows police and firefighters responding to the scene, where the tent was torn open and partially collapsed.

The victims include six adults and eight children, ranging in age from 1 to 17 years old; one child remains in stable condition in the hospital, while three adults remain hospitalized in stable condition.
The incident has significant public safety implications, particularly concerning distracted driving, vehicle control, and emergency response protocols.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the only fatality in the incident, making her central to the human impact of the event.

namedEntities.name: Jocelyn Route

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided firsthand eyewitness testimony describing the crash and its aftermath, adding credibility and community context to the report.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure in the crime, having fled the scene and later turning himself in, raising concerns about public safety and accountability.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, drove into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing 31-year-old Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez and injuring 13 others, including six adults and eight children aged 1 to 17. The driver initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in. Eyewitness Jocelyn Route, a former school board member and local council member, reported hearing explosions and seeing children injured. A video on X shows emergency responders at the scene, where the tent was torn open and partially collapsed. All victims were taken to hospitals, with one child in stable condition and several adults still hospitalized. The incident raises urgent public safety concerns about distracted driving and vehicle control.
title: Driver plows into child’s birthday party in Maryland, killing 1 and injuring 13, turns himself in
